description: Joining Innovation Department as a Software Engineering intern gives you the opportunity to experience an exciting, fast-paced startup environment hands on. We’re looking for a passionate Computer Science student who has a strong understanding of Python to work on latest frontend and backend tools and technologies. Work directly with our Engineering team to learn how to build components of a SaaS e-Learning platform.Innovation Department builds sustainability mobile solutions from the ground up. Our team of brand strategists, marketers, operators and builders are obsessed with reducing the time to product-market fit and creating repeatable success for the launch of early-stage products & Services in the sustainability sector.Responsibilities/ Tasks: •  Daily responsibilities will include:- Software development- Software quality assurance- Hardware/software troubleshooting and testing• Gather requirements, develop test plans, and develop and deploy stable modules to support archiving and backup of data as required by external regulators• Test and Validate automated backup solution along with an indexing strategy to easily retrieve relevant data based on archive propertiesRequirements: • Strong development skills using Python (and secondarily Perl/shell) is needed• Require course credit or OPT training for International students • Strong expertise working in a Linux/Unix environment • Good understanding of software design, local and cloud  systems (Google cloud) is a plus• Must have the ability to communicate effectively with  engineers and software developers and be detail oriented and self-driven.

As an intern, you are an intimate part of the entire design process from the initial design concept, to prototype, to testing, to mass production. Gain real-world exposure to problems and issues that perhaps are not found in textbooks. Increase your marketability to employers.   Try before you buy experience, as an intern you will get to evaluate Code or even the career paths prior to committing to full-time employment. Increase your self-confidence in the workplace, while easing the transition from being a student to entering the workforce. Have resume building experience while applying concepts and principles you have learned during school. Receive hands-on experience and exposure to real-world scenarios. Network with professionals in your field, for references and future job opportunities. Earn income; all Code internships are paid an hourly wage. Code offers flexible hours for our interns

Job Information

NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory Computer Science Intern IV in Pasadena, California

Computer Science Intern IV

Job Details

Job ID:12149

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. Thats our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answersliterally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your missionyour opportunityis to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If youre driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, youre ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities

We are seeking a part-time intern to join the Artificial Intelligence (AI), Analytics and Innovative Development team. This intern will have the opportunity to contribute in the following ways:

*

Will be provided with hands-on work experience in the application of conceptual and theoretic curriculum within Software and Computing Systems.

*

Will be responsible for providing development support to various AI, Analytics, Data Science and innovation activities.

*

Will partner with the Enterprise 2.0 Transformation activities and support prototyping and pilots between ITSD and various stakeholders around the laboratory.

Qualifications

Required Skills:

*

Must be currently enrolled at least half-time at an accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.

*

Must be able to work between 8 and 30 hours per week.

*

Minimum GPA 3.0.

*

Has some familiarity in one or more of the following areas: Data Science, Natural Language Processing, Artificial Intelligence, Data Visualization.

*

Completed coursework with exposure to standard principles, theories, concepts and techniques in Software or Aerospace engineering.

*

Knowledge and experience with MS Office.

*

Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.

Desired Skills:

*

Python programming

*

Full stack development and web application development

*

Prior internship experience in related software and computing systems discipline.

*

Participation in student organizations.

Work Authorization

Ability to Obtain Work Authorization

Connect with Us

Not ready to apply? Connect with us at https://experienced-jpl.icims.com/connect for general consideration.

position: Internship in Management Information Systems - Fall
description:
Mercedes-Benz: Building Exceptional Vehicles… and Careers!

The best chapters in Alabama’s automotive success story are yet to come. The Mercedes-Benz automobile of the future will be different; greener, more efficient, safer, and even more fascinating. Only one thing will never change – It will wear a star.

MBUSI is home to the GLE, GLE Coupe, and GLS Sport Utility Vehicles produced for all global markets. Our facility is one of the most advanced automotive manufacturing facilities in the world, with over 6 million square feet under one roof. The plant, located in Tuscaloosa County, Alabama, is positioned in an area of natural beauty and abundant natural resources.

MBUSI offers an excellent compensation and benefits package including health and life insurance, 401(k) and retirement, on-site child development and wellness facilities. MBUSI is committed to excellence and actively promotes teamwork, safety, quality, and continuous improvement within its ranks. Our Team Members share a common goal to always be the best premium auto manufacturer in North America.

Mercedes-Benz, U.S. International, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. Mercedes-Benz U.S. International, Inc. follows all local, state and federal laws in all aspects of business.

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply for any open positions.

Purpose of the Position:

Intern students will have the opportunity to gain real world working experience in the Mercedes-Benz manufacturing environment in either one or multiple departments during his/her work term.

Essential Functions:

Work with respective management to structure a main project for the term.

Perform daily/weekly tasks as instructed by your supervisor.

Schedule and attend meetings with your supervisor and mentor(s) to gain feedback and discuss progress on the project and tasks assigned.

Conduct an end-of-term presentation and/or final presentation with your team including your respective E4, E3, and E2 (if final).

Complete any required trainings for the department including but not limited to Mercedes Production Systems (MPS).

Act as an ambassador for the company by demonstrating integrity and maintaining corporate values with a positive and energetic attitude.

Perform safe work practices and participate in trainings and safety programs in a positive and proactive way by following safety rules, procedures, regulations, standards and laws. Report all unsafe acts, unsafe conditions, and injuries to supervisor or Human Resources.

Work safely 100" of the time.

Perform other duties as required.

Example projects

Support implementation of a team relations digital management system

Automation of inventory planning report

Successfully receive and analyze RFQ (request for quote) from suppliers to create value analysis

QUALIFICATIONS: Education, Experience and Necessary Skills all must be met in order to qualify for position.

Education:

Pursuing Bachelor's or Master's degree in the United States in Management Information Systems or in a related area.

Experience:

Applicants must be able to work full-time at the plant in Tuscaloosa from August 2020 to December 2020. Qualified applicants must be currently enrolled as a student in an accredited university in a relevant field of study and in good standing.

Necessary Skills, Certifications, etc.:

Ability to effectively and efficiently operate a computer with such programs as MSWord, Excel, etc.4

Preferred Skills:

Dependent upon department or working area.

position: STEM Software Engineering Intern Air Traffic Control
description:
DescriptionJob Description:This is a STEM Intern software engineering position with Leidos' Transportation Solutions business unit. Specifically you will be working on teams responsible for developing and maintaining FAA air traffic control software. The environment is object oriented (primarily C++/Java), or C language on a UNIX/Linux platform. Seeking applicants with Computer Science/Software Engineering background and interest. Design, develop, document, test and debug software that contains logical and mathematical solutions to business/mission problems. Apply appropriate standards, processes, procedures and tools throughout the software development life cycle. Familiarity with UNIX, ANSI C/C++ (including POSIX), networking, multi-threaded programming and Linux/GNU or equivalent development and debugging environment beneficial. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

The En Route Display Management (EDSM) CSCI is home to the following areas:

Radar Position Displays, D-position Views, A-Position Support, Specialist Displays, Commands, Data Synchronization and Settings, Flight Strip Printing and Toolbar Management.

EDSM provides controllers with a real-time display which provides a graphical view of the current air traffic situation, including aircraft position (targets), flight information (data blocks), strobes, radar weather, Next-Generation Weather Radar (NEXRAD), geographical maps and other information.

Primary Responsibilities

In this position, you will work with a team of software developers, system integrators and system engineers supporting a number of Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) programs.

Specific responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining FAA air traffic control software (primarily C, C++/Java) on a UNIX/Linux platform. Strong communication skills.Experience in following a documented Software Development ProcessTroubleshooting technical issuesExperience using version control tools such as Git, Subversion or CVSExperience in the use of UNIX and Linux operating systems

Basic Qualifications

Applicants for this position must meet the following requirements:

2020 High School GraduateAcceptance letter from college for fall 2020Passing grade in AP Java or AP Computer Science classParticipant in District 196 E3 STEM ProgramPursue a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fieldFamiliarity with the following: Linux/UNIX C/C++ Java Scripting languages (PERL, C#)Excellent written/verbal skills.
Candidates must be enrolled in a degree program in a relevant discipline.
This is a job opening for a STEM High School graduate from local High School District 196. 

Preferred Qualifications

Previous experience with Air Traffic Control Software or Systems.

position: Intern IT Innovation: Computer Science fields of Data, Innovation, Architecture, Cyber Security & Analytics
description:
Security Benefit (SB), a leader in the retirement saving and income solutions market, seeks Interns to join the IT Department. Security Benefit has been dedicated to helping clients plan and save for retirement for nearly five decades. Over the last several years it has become a top provider of retirement products and services through a nationwide network of independent financial representatives. Interns will work in our home office in Topeka, Kansas. We are seeking interns to join us during Summer 2020 and the Fall Semester 2020.

As a note, over the last two years, Security Benefit has successfully supported students completing internships in the disciplines ofTechnology Development, Reporting /Analytics, Architecture and Cybersecurity.



General Accountabilities:

Interns will work under the supervision of an IT Leader and will assist in developing technology solutions to meet business needs and/or develop IT capabilities. Primary duties and responsibilities:


Attend meetings with business and IT users to help with gathering functional and non-functional requirements.Perform application development and activities in support& development of databases.Assist with Proof of Concept projects, researching/evaluating vendor products to meet business and IT capabilities.Document technical standards, create templates (e.g. within AWS) and any appropriate documentation.

Qualifications:

Full-time student in Computer Science, EE, Information Systems or Data/Business AnalyticsUndergraduate or Graduate StudentA quick learner with motivation to learn more about new technologies combined with good listening skills and detail orientationGood communication skills and able to work with a lot of different teamsSomeone who wants hands on experience

Technical Skills (some examples---not all required for each internship):


Working knowledge of languages such as Java, PHP, Python, C++ or C#Working knowledge of RDBMS like MS SQL. Proficiency in writing SQL queriesWorking knowledge of ETL and a good understanding of Object Oriented ProgrammingWorking knowledge of languages such as Java, PHP, Python, C++ or C#Exposure to Business Intelligence/Data mining tools

Eligibility:

Students eligible for an internship must be current full-time students. Students working during the school year will work approximately 10-19 hours a week. SB will offer a flexible schedule to allow students to focus on coursework while gaining real work experience during their internship. Students eligible for the summer internship will also be full-time students and available to work up to 40 hours per week.

Consider joining our progressive team in our nationally recognized company. Visit the career section of our website at www.securitybenefit.com/careers to complete the online application and submit your resume. EOE

At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.Cadence Voltus includes full chip PDN model extraction and analysis. Cadence Sigrity include system level(SI and PI) analysis with Sigrity package and

board models. As a research and developer intern, you will work on Voltus/Sigrity integration projects.

Position Requirements:

You need to have a solid foundation in chip model extraction and circuit simulation. Besides that, you need to have hands on experience in programming and computer science.

Currently pursuing a Master's or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field.

Experience with model extraction and SPICE circuit simulation.

Experience with algorithms, data structures and complexity data processing, Familiarity with programming using C, C++.We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.

Opportunities to work with domestic and international companies: Canduit matches undergraduate/master's students and recently graduated students with opportunities to work with corporate companies such as Uber, Marriott, and LiveNation or start-ups located both in the United States and internationally. These projects are completed remotely from your campus or home--no need to be based in Denver!What you'll do: Over the course of an academic semester, academic quarter, or in just a few weeks, you'll work on software engineering projects that could range in areas from:Quality assuranceMobile application developmentWeb developmentRoadmaps + prioritization of product featuresResearchEtc.Invite your peers, professors, or professional advisers to collaborate and work with you.To get started: Go to https://canduit.co/ to register as a Student/Recent Grad or Student Club and request a project.Qualifications: Currently enrolled undergraduate or graduate studentRecent graduate from a higher educational institutionJob Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary, InternshipSalary: $0.00 /hourAdditional Compensation:Other formsWork Location:Fully RemoteBenefits:Work from homeFlexible scheduleInternship Compensation:PayCollege CreditThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionInnovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativityThis Job Is:A good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreA good job for someone just entering the workforce or returning to the workforce with limited experience and educationSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Remotely:Yes

position: National Business, Marketing, Media, Film, Computer Science, Management, Entrepreneurial, Virtual Internship
description: To learn more about NSTEM:Visit our website www.nstem.orgCheck out NSTEM on social media!Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/nstemhsInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/nstemhsTwitter: https://twitter.com/nstemhsLinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/national-stem-honor-societyIf you are interested in applying, please fill out our application: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSehWKx8qVVAp1F7LO4M3L-q5F4w0IWDxocg0Pws0JQU6d-ZWQ/viewform This internship can be fulfilled both locally in our office in Gloucester, MA or virtually from anywhere around the globe!   The National STEM Honor Society (NSTEM) has been in the development stage for 2.5 years and went live in February 2020 with the goal of opening thousands of Chapters across the nation as quickly as possible! Our mission is to inspire innovation and recognize student excellence From K to Career in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics. That’s right, we are going to be inspiring kids as young as Kindergarten to get involved and stay involved in STEM hopefully for the rest of their education and careers! Please visit our website at www.nstem.org to really understand NSTEM and the benefits of starting an NSTEM chapter. Also, please take a look at the National STEM Honor Society social media platforms on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn.  What are the opportunities to get involved as an intern? What do interns do for the National STEM Honor Society?  The National STEM Honor Society is an educational and business start-up organization that provides University interns with interesting, diverse, and stimulating work opportunities. At NSTEM, you are not limited to just one role, and we encourage you to take advantage of the opportunity to explore a variety of roles, experiences, opportunities, and responsibilities. Supporting your specific interests and individual learning goals, you will engage in focused learning experiences working on projects essential to the day-to-day operation of the company where you will receive guidance and resources to apply knowledge and skills to your emerging professional lives. As an intern with National STEM Honor Society, you can perform a myriad of real and meaningful tasks.  1. Marketing: This is an opportunity to help, to develop and to execute a nation-wide marketing program through social media, email, website, LinkedIn, conference planning, meetings, etc. The company is at the beginning and it is a very exciting time to have a real impact on the company branding and culture. There will be high expectations of strategic thinking followed by targeted, results oriented action in a team environment.Film Production: the National STEM Honor Society will have its own YouTube Channel which requires the development of a constant flow of high quality, branded content. We need to create a brand that will be the backbone of the company for years to come. Creative film production and strategic film distribution are critical elements of the rapid growth of NSTEM.Social Media: campaigns creation and execution on a national, targeted basis. There are several specific target markets, each with very different characteristics in terms of sending customized, strategic messages employing the correct social media platforms for each target market.Email Campaigns: hyper targeted Email campaigns and the maintaining of highly categorized databases. This is an opportunity to really specifically target our customers and to have them start chapters with us and to stay with us over many decades to come.2. Website Development: NSTEM is built on the Wordpress platform, needing constant updates both coded and not. Our entire social media campaign will be aimed at sending targeted persons to different parts of our website for different desired results. The key result is to increase the number of chapters across the country in record time.3. Resource Development: assist a team in developing unique content for the website including resources and projects. When a school opens a chapter, that unleashes at least 1,000 resources that become available to them for projects, scholarships, awards, grants, etc. This is a key element of the service that we provide to our chapters and it is very valuable to them.4. Merchandise: constantly researching and discovering new merchandise that matches our mission. Merch includes apparel, personalized banners, and recognition items (like pins, cords, certificates). Build relationships with e-commerce experts and fulfillment centers outside of NSTEM and research specific products to maximize profit. Promoting in creative ways our line of merchandise will be a key objective. How can we create video and other exciting content to show off our merchandise while bringing a real level of fun to all involved?5. Business Development, Entrepreneurship, & Operations:Strategy Development: involvement in the day to day strategy of the operations of a small and rapidly growing organization. You will be part of a team that is very focused, demanding creativity and execution in a very fast paced environment.Sales: learn how to create an effective sales program and close sales across the country. We believe that effective selling is helping people make decisions that are good for them. We believe that what we are selling is of great value to our kids and to the future of our country. If you choose to participate in this sector of the company, you will be trained by a professional to sell professionally and with empathy. We will be adding value to our chapters and people at every opportunity. Customer Service: engage with different public audiences and learn how to effectively communicate with them. Our goal is to have new chapters and for those chapters to sign up for NSTEM year after year after year. In order to do this we need to focus on our existing chapters, to communicate with them often and to add value and satisfaction at every opportunity. 6. Management & Leadership: be given the opportunity to lead small and large teams on a myriad of projects. There is so much to be done in this exciting new venture that we will need leaders to understand our goals and to bring teams together to get results in a highly motivational and quality way. 7. Grant Writing: as we secure a 501(c)(3) fiscal sponsor, our team will be writing a series of large grants to national corporations and foundations to secure funding for NSTEM chapters.   Accredited Internship & Course Credit: NSTEM will work with colleges and universities to provide an experience that is directly related to desired learning outcomes and will complete all necessary paperwork. NSTEM provides this accredited opportunity by supporting interns in meeting program requirements and agrees to provide written documentation of work performed, recommendations, and evaluations for interns (according to performance standards). Additionally, there is a “volunteer option” instead of an official “internship option” for this opportunity if your college/university permits. In order to offer an internship that complies with federal labor laws, NSTEM adheres to the following conditions:The intern clearly understands that there is no expectation of compensation, this is an unpaid internship opportunityNSTEM internships provide training similar to that given in an educational environmentThis internship can be tied to intern’s formal education programs by the receipt of academic creditNSTEM internships accommodate intern’s academic commitments and provide significant educational benefitsThe duration of this internship provides beneficial learning for a specified amount of time Intern’s work complements, rather than displaces, the work of paid employeesInternships are conducted without entitlement to a paid job at the conclusion of the internshipIntern Goals & Learning Objectives: An intern working for the National STEM Honor Society can expect to meet their academic and learning goals, career exploration, and industry knowledge led by a committed staff providing an experience to meet them:  Increase knowledge of the industryGrow leadership skills and learning to manage large projectsGain experience in adapting to changing roles and environmentsConduct research and practice analytical/quantitative skillsAssertively engage at work, conduct research effectively, write and present professionally, and make business decisionsUnderstand and implement the roles and responsibilities of Project Managers, which include: Track team members’ schedules, tasks, needs, and interestsGain proficiency with tools such as G Suite, Trello, SmartSheetsProvide a constant flow of work for team membersEstablish and use effective communication channels with team membersTreat team members & other managers with kindness, understanding and respectOrganize project materials to achieve outcomes efficiently     Learn to ramp up quickly on new projectsLead by example, which means rolling up your sleeves and diving into the project!NSTEM’s Three Areas of Focus:Enroll NSTEM Chapters across the nation as quickly as possible by reaching out to educators, education departments and synergistic organizations,Attract corporate sponsors and foundation grants to provide funding to various NSTEM chapters,Reach out and attract strategic partners and advisory council members.Supervision & Mentoring: All interns working for NSTEM will be mentored and supervised by our staff. Directors and Intern/Project Managers offer diverse educational backgrounds and expertise within their respective fields. Staff members provide opportunities for interns to work on projects that align with their learning goals with evaluation and constructive feedback along the way. NSTEM believes that successful internships go hand in hand with enjoyable internships. Staff will personally check-in with you throughout your internship experience and make adjustments as necessary in order to ensure that you achieve your internship goals.  Our team is constantly available for interns that work in the office as well as those that work virtually. Staff works with the requirements of colleges and universities in order to provide written feedback according to their specific policies. We work tirelessly to ensure all of our interns get the attention they need in pursuant to their internship goals. Interns also have the opportunity to learn from each other as there is much collaboration between both local and remote interns. Being a part of the National STEM Honor Society expansion is an outstanding opportunity to grow your business, entrepreneurship, film production, social media, marketing, sales, service, and outreach capabilities while contributing to a team with the deep purpose of inspiring more STEM into the lives of our students, educators, sponsors, partners and advisory council members. Interns are given the opportunity to make strategic decisions and practice active learning and reflective thinking. They work in diverse teams with other interns, either in the office or through virtual connections. Because of the cooperative nature of NSTEM’s projects, interns are encouraged to form continuing networking relationships with each other. Team building is supported in order to set interns up to thrive in a collaborative environment. After interning at NSTEM, interns have valuable and applicable skills for finding meaningful and productive environmental work gaining valuable work experience in the process.Duration Requirements: Whether the internship is for credit or not, NSTEM hires interns for a minimum of 180 total hours with no maximum, and a 3 month (15 hour/week) minimum. We have had interns with us in our parent company for as long as two years and are still part of the organization.     To learn more about NSTEM:Visit our website www.nstem.orgCheck out NSTEM on social media!Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/nstemhsInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/nstemhsTwitter: https://twitter.com/nstemhsLinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/national-stem-honor-society

description:
Security Benefit (SB), a leader in the retirement saving and income solutions market, seeks Interns to join the IT Department. Security Benefit has been dedicated to helping clients plan and save for retirement for nearly five decades. Over the last several years it has become a top provider of retirement products and services through a nationwide network of independent financial representatives. Interns will work in our home office in Topeka, Kansas. We are seeking interns to join us during Summer 2020 and the Fall Semester 2020.

As a note, over the last two years, Security Benefit has successfully supported students completing internships in the disciplines ofTechnology Development, Reporting /Analytics, Architecture and Cybersecurity.



General Accountabilities:

Interns will work under the supervision of an IT Leader and will assist in developing technology solutions to meet business needs and/or develop IT capabilities. Primary duties and responsibilities:


Attend meetings with business and IT users to help with gathering functional and non-functional requirements.Perform application development and activities in support& development of databases.Assist with Proof of Concept projects, researching/evaluating vendor products to meet business and IT capabilities.Document technical standards, create templates (e.g. within AWS) and any appropriate documentation.

Full-time student in Computer Science, EE, Information Systems or Data/Business AnalyticsUndergraduate or Graduate StudentA quick learner with motivation to learn more about new technologies combined with good listening skills and detail orientationGood communication skills and able to work with a lot of different teamsSomeone who wants hands on experience

Proficiency in writing SQL queriesWorking knowledge of ETL and a good understanding of Object Oriented ProgrammingWorking knowledge of languages such as Java, PHP, Python, C++ or C#Exposure to Business Intelligence/Data mining tools

position: Masters Intern National Security Masters Intern - Computing and Analytics (NSIP)
description:
Organization and Job ID

Job ID:

Directorate: National Security

Division: Computing & Analytics

Job_Description

PNNL is seeking graduate students for assignments within the National Security

Internship Program (NSIP). The Computing and Analytics Division is looking for

individuals who have a passion for solving critical national challenges using

advanced computational, statistical, and mathematical techniques. The intern

will be given an opportunity to be presented with complex problems in national

security, energy, and science; apply cutting-edge research to make our nation

safer and stronger; develop complex computer code; develop and participate in

cyber competitions; design new visualization; work with big data, and optimize

solutions in diverse domains.

Positions are available in Richland, WA and Seattle, WA, based on business

need. Positions may also be performed remotely or on campus at PNNL based on

business need.

This internship can accommodate general internships as appropriate and co-op

duration opportunities.

Participants will be starting in cohort sessions and must be available to start

in September (Fall cohort) or January (Winter/Spring cohort).

Diverse Focus Areas: Your internship can be in one of six technical groups.



Applied Statistics & Computational Modeling: Employ powerful tools and


techniques, such as mathematical modeling and computational statistics,

graph and game theory, network science, and uncertainty quantification to

solve complex problems in a variety of domains.

Disciplines: Applied Mathematics, Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations

Research



Cyber Security: Deliver first-of-a-kind solutions ranging from network


and software development to embedded systems to protect our nation s

critical strategic assets. Develop cyber technologies and processes that

have direct impact on our national security and scientific missions.

Disciplines: Cyber Security, Computer Science



Data Sciences & Analytics: Operate on the data-to-knowledge continuum


distilling large, fast, distributed, and messy data into knowledge to

support decision processes.

Disciplines: Applied Machine Learning, Data Architectures, Data Engineering,

Data Science, Deep Learning, Geoinformatics, Applied, Mathematics



Operations & Analysis: Use a multitude of information sources to identify


threats to critical networks and systems, creating tools that help us

become more efficient at identifying those threats.

Disciplines: Cyber Security, Computer Science, Information Management



Software Engineering & Architectures: Develop and deliver well-


architected software-centric systems and deploy sustainable software and

hardware systems used in high-impact production environments.

Disciplines: Mobile Application Development, Software Engineering, Software

Testing



Visual Analytics: Combine innovative interactive visualizations with


advanced automated data analysis techniques to enable users to gain

deeper insights from their data.Make complex data useful through skillful

visual design, compelling human computer interaction, sound analytic

methods, and solid engineering.

Disciplines: Data Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Information

Visualization, User Experience, Virtual/Augmented Reality

in the United States. BMI is an E-Verify employer. Learn more at .

Software Engineering Intern - Summer 2020

location Hanover, Maryland Hanover category Engineering Full-Time Job ID: 16840 Posted: Jun 17th 2020



JOB DESCRIPTION

Company Profile

Oceaneering is a global provider of engineered services and products, primarily to the offshore energy industry. We develop products and services for use throughout the lifecycle of an offshore oilfield, from drilling to decommissioning. We operate the world's premier fleet of work class ROVs. Additionally, we are a leader in offshore oilfield maintenance services, umbilicals, subsea hardware, and tooling. We also use applied technology expertise to serve the defense, entertainment, material handling, aerospace, science, and renewable energy industries.

Oceaneering Technologies (OTECH) performs a wide range of engineering services and products for unique marine systems for military and commercial customers. OTECH innovates wherever practical rather than inventing making it faster to field than others in its industry; the typical development/delivery cycle for complex mechanical, hydraulic, electrical systems is often completed in 12-15 months. Technical capabilities span the entire engineering spectrum. These skills have been demonstrated in successfully delivered systems, including Remotely Operated Vehicles (ROVs); Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (AUVs); saturation diving systems; surface and sub-surface vehicle launch and recovery systems; advanced offshore cranes; and life support systems.

For more information please go to www.oceaneering.com and click on Products & Services, then click Oceaneering Technologies (OTECH).

Position Summary

Engineering Internship positions at Oceaneering will provide opportunities to gain experience in the "real world" work environment. The student will typically be assigned a mentor who will direct their internship experience. Work or project assignments (some with strict deadlines to meet) will be commensurate with the student's academic background to take advantage of their expertise and provide real life application of their classroom knowledge. At the same time, opportunities will be provided for students to expand their knowledge outside the boundaries of their classroom.

ESSENTIAL

* Internship may be in a technical or business area and can include experiences with application development, application support, programming, project management, business analysis, database administration, network and systems management, as well as many others.

* Assist in the development of high quality software systems utilizing an array of technologies
* Responsible for all phases of the software development life cycle
* Create and maintain software documentation such as: verification procedures, requirement specifications, interface control documents, testing reports, etc.
* Work as part of a cross-functional team to meet customer requirements

* Willing to stretching beyond their experience and to take risks to achieve objectives

Qualifications

Education/Experience:

Currently enrolled in a Bachelors degree program as a rising junior or senior or a graduate degree program.

Degree should be from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics, or chemistry. ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.

* This position requires the ability to obtain an active Secret U.S. Security Clearance, for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship
* Ability to work full-time during defined internship period.

* Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)

Preferred:

* Academic excellence and community involvement

* Knowledge of database management systems such as Microsoft SQL server, Oracle, or MySql
* Experience developing with ESRI ARCGIS libraries
* Experience with web-based development
* Proficiency in UML modeling, test-driven development, agile processes, or DevOps tools
* Experience with Wireshark or other network packet analysis software
* Experience troubleshooting electrical circuits using multi-meters, oscilloscopes, and other test tools

* Comfortable configuring, developing, and debugging on the Linux operating system
* Comfortable configuring, developing, and debugging on the Windows operating system
* Experience with Linux kernel architecture
* Familiarity with cryptography and underlying algorithms
* Hands-on experience with hardware interfaces, embedded processor architectures, microcontrollers, I/O device drivers, and board support packages

Equal Opportunity Employer

Thank you for taking the time to consider an internship at WorkBoard! We are building a solution customers love and an epic-growth company with an incredibly talented and dedicated team. We started WorkBoard in 2014 because we realized that the single-most important process in any company was how it defines, aligns and drives its strategy forward and yet it is the least automated, transparent and data driven.

Every company has strategic priorities and urgency to achieve them and every employee should have line of sight to how they move the needle!

More about us: https://www.workboard.com/hrfiles/The_WorkBoard_Story.pdf

THE BASICS


6 remote summer internships
Projected start date 7/13/2020
6-8 weeks, full-time internship (part time may be possible)
$30 per hour, laptop supplied, $300 home office setup reimbursement
Preferred locations: AR, CA, CO, GA, IL, MD, MI, MN, NM, NY, OR, TX, UT, WY

THE OPPORTUNITY

As a software engineering intern, you will be a part of an internship program which will not only give you an opportunity to apply your computer science knowledge to real world applications but also participate in and attend personal career planning sessions. You will get to work directly with the Sr. Director of Engineering, and you will have room to shape your work by influencing the product we build, our daily engineering processes and tools we use to do our work. We promise that you will have an opportunity to have an impact on our product.

COMING IN


Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree program in Computer Science, or related technical field. 

Experience with Data Structures and Algorithms demonstrated by coursework, projects and/or research. 

 Experience with coding in a general purpose programming language such as C, C++, Java, JavaScript, or Python. 

Interested in building web applications, mobile applications and/or developing machine learning algorithms. 

THE WORKBOARD STORY

WorkBoard provides a powerful, modern results platform to help companies achieve their growth plans. Unlike most enterprise software, our solution is important to every employee, so we strive to set the high bar for capabilities that delight and enable everyone to be more successful at work. WorkBoard is strategic to companies and personally relevant to the people that work in them.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates learning, diversity and inclusion. If you're hungry to grow your skills while growing a company, your sense of urgency matches the size of our market opportunity, and you value and enable team mates' contributions, then come join us!

DescriptionJob Description:This is a STEM Intern software engineering position with Leidos' Transportation Solutions business unit. Specifically you will be working on teams responsible for developing and maintaining FAA air traffic control software. The environment is object oriented (primarily C++/Java), or C language on a UNIX/Linux platform. Seeking applicants with Computer Science/Software Engineering background and interest. Design, develop, document, test and debug software that contains logical and mathematical solutions to business/mission problems. Familiarity with UNIX, ANSI C/C++ (including POSIX), networking, multi-threaded programming and Linux/GNU or equivalent development and debugging environment beneficial. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

The En Route Display Management (EDSM) CSCI is home to the following areas:

Radar Position Displays, D-position Views, A-Position Support, Specialist Displays, Commands, Data Synchronization and Settings, Flight Strip Printing and Toolbar Management.

EDSM provides controllers with a real-time display which provides a graphical view of the current air traffic situation, including aircraft position (targets), flight information (data blocks), strobes, radar weather, Next-Generation Weather Radar (NEXRAD), geographical maps and other information.

Primary Responsibilities

In this position, you will work with a team of software developers, system integrators and system engineers supporting a number of Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) programs.

Specific responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining FAA air traffic control software (primarily C, C++/Java) on a UNIX/Linux platform. Strong communication skills.Experience in following a documented Software Development ProcessTroubleshooting technical issuesExperience using version control tools such as Git, Subversion or CVSExperience in the use of UNIX and Linux operating systems

2020 High School GraduateAcceptance letter from college for fall 2020Passing grade in AP Java or AP Computer Science classParticipant in District 196 E3 STEM ProgramPursue a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fieldFamiliarity with the following: Linux/UNIX C/C++ Java Scripting languages (PERL, C#)Excellent written/verbal skills.

About the Job

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. * Perform research to advance the science and technology of intelligent machines
* Perform research that enables learning the semantics of data (images, video, text, audio, and other modalities)
* Devise better data-driven models of human behavior, and/or
* Contribute research that can be applied to Facebook product development

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

* Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a degree (PhD, Masters, or Bachelors with relevant research experience) in Computer Science or related field
* Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Publications or experience in machine learning, AI, computer vision, optimization, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, or data science
* Experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
* Ability to manipulate and analyze complex, large scale, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
* Experience in utilizing theoretical and empirical research to solve problems
* Ability to communicate complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
* Knowledge in C, C++, Python, Lua or other related programming language
* Experience building systems based on machine learning and/or deep learning methods
* Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op

Are you looking for something more than just an internship? SAS is making a difference in peoples lives all around the world. SAS intern program gives you the opportunity to help create analytics software that turns data  about customers, operations, financial, and more  into insight. In 140 countries, our customers use SAS to battle cybercrime, speed drugs to market, streamline supply chains, boost marketing and so much more. And you can do all of this in one place  our World Headquarters in Cary, NC.

During your internship at SAS, youll partner with some of the brightest minds in the world on business-critical projects, and youll have the opportunity to be immersed in our award-winning culture, grow your social and professional network, interact with our senior leadership, and share your contributions with the entire company.

If you are a rock star student looking for the next step to build your career, the SAS intern program is the perfect fit for you.

This is a year-round internship opportunity for local students only and in close proximity to Cary, NC. You must not be graduating prior to May 2021.

Role Overview:

This internship position will have the opportunity to partner directly with an experienced software developer on our IOT Event Stream Processing team to help build out publishing and subscribing adapters and connectors for Event Stream Processing. We strive for excellence in the development and delivery of high-quality applications across an expanding set of technologies.

The Event Stream Processing (ESP) product suite contains 4 products:

1. ESP Full for on-premise and in-cloud
2. ESP Cluster for ESP in Viya
3. ESP Edge for in-devices such as drones and IOT Gateways
4. Event Stream Manager for monitoring and managing ESP instances at scale.

Read more here: https://www.sas.com/en_us/software/event-stream-processing.html

What are we looking for?

* Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university seeking a computer science, statistics, and any other majors involving large scale science computing in a US Based school. Not graduating prior to May 2021
* Ability to work in the Cary office 10-15 hours during the Academic year, and full time hours during the summer
* Passion for programming and data mining
* Familiar with C/C++, Java, and networking protocols.

Nice to have:

* Experience with any Event Stream Processing products or concepts.

SAS looks not only for the right skills, but also a fit to our core values. We seek colleagues who will contribute to the unique values that makes SAS such a great place to work. We look for the total candidate: technical skills, values fit, relationship skills, problem solvers, good communicators and, of course, innovators. Candidates must be ready to make an impact.

Company Profile

Oceaneering is a global provider of engineered services and products, primarily to the offshore energy industry. We develop products and services for use throughout the lifecycle of an offshore oilfield, from drilling to decommissioning. We operate the world's premier fleet of work class ROVs. Additionally, we are a leader in offshore oilfield maintenance services, umbilicals, subsea hardware, and tooling. We also use applied technology expertise to serve the defense, entertainment, material handling, aerospace, science, and renewable energy industries.

Oceaneering Technologies (OTECH) performs a wide range of engineering services and products for unique marine systems for military and commercial customers. OTECH innovates wherever practical rather than inventing making it “faster to field” than others in its industry; the typical development/delivery cycle for complex mechanical, hydraulic, electrical systems is often completed in 12-15 months. Technical capabilities span the entire engineering spectrum. These skills have been demonstrated in successfully delivered systems, including Remotely Operated Vehicles (ROVs); Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (AUVs); saturation diving systems; surface and sub-surface vehicle launch and recovery systems; advanced offshore cranes; and life support systems.

For more information please go to www.oceaneering.com and click on Products & Services, then click Oceaneering Technologies (OTECH).

Position Summary

Engineering Internship positions at Oceaneering will provide opportunities to gain experience in the "real world" work environment. The student will typically be assigned a mentor who will direct their internship experience. Work or project assignments (some with strict deadlines to meet) will be commensurate with the student's academic background to take advantage of their expertise and provide real life application of their classroom knowledge. At the same time, opportunities will be provided for students to expand their knowledge outside the boundaries of their classroom.

Duties & Responsibilities

ESSENTIAL

Internship may be in a technical or business area and can include experiences with application development, application support, programming, project management, business analysis, database administration, network and systems management, as well as many others.
Interns are given the opportunity to apply their skills and gain an understanding of the Oceaneering organization.
Assist in the development of high quality software systems utilizing an array of technologies
Responsible for all phases of the software development life cycle
Create and maintain software documentation such as: verification procedures, requirement specifications, interface control documents, testing reports, etc.
Work as part of a cross-functional team to meet customer requirements
Dedicated to learning new software languages, architectures, and tools
Willing to stretching beyond their experience and to take risks to achieve objectives
Qualifications

Education/Experience:
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program as a rising junior or senior or a graduate degree program.

Degree should be from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics, or chemistry. ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.

This position requires the ability to obtain an active Secret U.S. Security Clearance, for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship
Ability to work full-time during defined internship period.
Familiarity with at least one high level programming language such as Java, C#, or C++
Familiarity with an integrated development environment (IDE) such as Visual Studio, Eclipse, or IntelliJ
Understanding of computer networking and security concepts
Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)

Preferred:
3.0+ cumulative GPA
Academic excellence and community involvement
Experience with additional programming languages and tools such as Python, JavaScript, SQL, TCL, XML, HTML, Matlab, etc.
Knowledge of database management systems such as Microsoft SQL server, Oracle, or MySql
Experience developing with ESRI ARCGIS libraries
Experience with web-based development
Proficiency in UML modeling, test-driven development, agile processes, or DevOps tools
Experience with Wireshark or other network packet analysis software
Experience troubleshooting electrical circuits using multi-meters, oscilloscopes, and other test tools
Understanding of more advanced networking involving switches, routers, firewalls, etc.
Comfortable configuring, developing, and debugging on the Linux operating system
Comfortable configuring, developing, and debugging on the Windows operating system

position: Stem Software Engineering Intern - Air Traffic Control
description:
Job ID: 10766392

Job Location:
Job Title: STEM Software Engineering Intern - Air Traffic Control
Work Type: Work Days: Work Vary: No , Shift: First (Day), Hours Per Week: 40, Work Type: Regular

Salary Offered: Unspecified
Benefits: Unspecified.

Physical Required: Unspecified
Drug Testing Required: Unspecified

Job Description:
Description Job Description: This is a STEM Intern software engineering position with Leidos' Transportation Solutions business unit. Specifically you will be working on teams responsible for developing and maintaining FAA air traffic control software. The environment is object oriented (primarily C++/Java), or C language on a UNIX/Linux platform. Seeking applicants with Computer Science/Software Engineering background and interest. Design, develop, document, test and debug software that contains logical and mathematical solutions to business/mission problems. Apply appropriate standards, processes, procedures and tools throughout the software development life cycle. Familiarity with UNIX, ANSI C/C++ (including POSIX), networking, multi-threaded programming and Linux/GNU or equivalent development and debugging environment beneficial. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. The En Route Display Management (EDSM) CSCI is home to the following areas: Radar Position Displays, D-position Views, A-Position Support, Specialist Displays, Commands, Data Synchronization and Settings, Flight Strip Printing and Toolbar Management. EDSM provides controllers with a real-time display which provides a graphical view of the current air traffic situation, including aircraft position (targets), flight information (data blocks), strobes, radar weather, Next-Generation Weather Radar (NEXRAD), geographical maps and other information. Primary Responsibilities In this position, you will work with a team of software developers, system integrators and system engineers supporting a number of Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) programs. Specific responsibilities include: + Developing and maintaining FAA air traffic control software (primarily C, C++/Java) on a UNIX/Linux platform. Strong communication skills. + Experience in following a documented Software Development Process + Troubleshooting technical issues + Experience using version control tools such as Git, Subversion or CVS + Experience in the use of UNIX and Linux operating systems Basic Qualifications Applicants for this position must meet the following requirements: + 2020 High School Graduate + Acceptance letter from college for fall 2020 + Passing grade in AP Java or AP Computer Science class + Participant in District 196 E3 STEM Program + Pursue a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field + Familiarity with the following: Linux/UNIX C/C++ Java Scripting languages (PERL, C#) + Excellent written/verbal skills. + Candidates must be enrolled in a degree program in a relevant discipline. + This is a job opening for a STEM High School graduate from local High School District 196. Preferred Qualifications Previous experience with Air Traffic Control Software or Systems. Pilot's License. External Referral Bonus:Ineligible Potential for Telework:No Clearance Level Required:Public Trust Travel:No Scheduled Weekly Hours:40 Shift:Day Requisition Category:Intern Job Family:Intern Technical Leidos is a Fortune 500� information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com. Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here. Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws. BOLD DISRUPTORS WELCOME.

Are you ready for a challenge that could launch your career? T-Mobile is revolutionizing the wireless industry for millions of customers nationwide. We've got an army of developers, project managers, engineers, and analysts all working like a well-oiled machine. This is teamwork at its best, with technical warriors bravely pushing the edges of the wireless frontier. Working here means rolling up your sleeves and disrupting the status quo with a team that has your back every step of the way.
Ready? Then you're invited to be a TechX Intern with our Technology Team.

The TechX Internship program is a 9-month, part-time paid learning experience that begins in October 2020 for students currently enrolled in a full-time Undergraduate degree program, majoring in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Cyber security, Data Management, IT or another Technology-related field. You'll work closely with your team, be paired with a mentor, and participate in projects alongside with some of the best senior technologists in the industry. For our eager explorers, you'll also have the opportunity to rotate teams giving you exposure to a wide variety of technologies across our organization.

**What you'll do in your role.**

Working as an Intern on our Software & Development Team means taking on responsibilities, projects, and critical issues that impact our business and customers in real-time. We'll have software/development opportunities like internal and external systems/applications design, software testing and bug fixes, business reporting, database management, and product/service delivery (just to name a few!).

You'll contribute your creativity and great ideas, and you'll be challenged to deliver complex software/development solutions. We'll give you hands-on projects and the chance to make an immediate impact. Here are some of the roles you could have as a software/development with our Technology Team...

-   Software Development
-   Software Testing
-   Systems Design
-   Systems Architecture
-   Software Engineer
-   Application Operations



JOB RESPONSIBILITIES WE HAVE IN STORE FOR YOU.

-   Participate in creating, developing & managing the deployment architecture for applications and platforms, including designing, coding, review, testing, and pushing code into production
-   Communicate design, requirements, functionality, and limitations of systems/applications
-   Build automation tools, including automate day-to-day operational tasks, deployments and monitoring tasks applications and platforms
-   Use of one or more programming languages (Java, C, C++, Python, etc.)
-   Knowledgeable and use in common Internet technologies and protocols such as HTTP, SSL, OAuth, REST, JSON, or XML
-   Knowledgeable and use in database system and functionalities and use of SQL, Power BI, or Tableau
-   Act as a liaison for intake process to software, develop and project teams
-   Implement monitoring, dashboards, escalations and alerts
-   Develop and drive incident management processes, playbooks and stakeholder communication mechanisms
-   Drive ongoing improvements and efficiency in operational practices, tools and processes
-   Resolve, report and present technical issues and solutions through problem-solving, teamwork, and effective communication skills to team and management

Stratus is seeking highly motivated and energetic students to intern with our Software Engineering team!

Why Join Us?

People count on Stratus when their important computer applications need to be up and running all the time. Current customers include credit card and ATM networks, hospitals, utilities, securities and brokerage firms, 9-1-1 emergency call centers and similar mission-critical operations where the potential harm from service failure is very high. Stratus is aggressively expanding the footprint of its uptime solutions with a push into the IoT edge.



Job Summary:

The intern will be working with Stratusrsquo;s advanced development team to develop a new high availability Linux based server. Technology components include virtualization technology, REST APIs, TCP/IP networking, and storage replication.

Working closely with the team, typical tasks will include:

* Designing, coding, and testing C/C++ components used to validate correct server operation.
* Scripting and running stability tests on the server and presenting results in a clear fashion.
* Working with developers to instrument code and gain insights on the server behavior.
* Learning new skills to do whatever it takes to help the team successfully deliver value to our customers.



Qualifications:

* Candidate for bachelorrsquo;s degree or higher in Computer Science or its equivalent.
* C/C++ programming experience.
* Linux command line and basic administration familiarity.
* Experience using Open Source software.
* Python programming experience.
* Good communication skills, comfortable working in a team orientated environment.

Software Engineering Intern

Location: Chicago, IL, USA
Req#: 525323




Employees Click Here To Refer

Company Information

Numerator is a data and technology company reinventing market research. Headquartered in Chicago, IL, Numerator has 1,600 employees worldwide. The company blends proprietary data with advanced technology to create unique insights for the market research industry that has been slow to change.  The majority of Fortune 100 companies are Numerator clients.

Job Description

Numerator is looking for a team player that has a passion for learning full stack applications as a Software Engineering Intern.   Work side by side with our Numerator Engineering team members to learn and contribute to building our market research software. This is a hands on role designed to introduce professional software engineering principles and practices to contribute to our data processing software.

 Take on substantial tasks that will contribute to our existing codebase.
 Have daily interactions with engineers on the Numerator engineering team.  Each member of the team has their own areas of expertise and they will all be available to collaborate and share experiences.
 Work with our big data pipeline that includes skills such as computer vision, machine learning and data processing using professional technologies such as Python, Django, MySQL, Vertica and OpenCV.
 Gain practical experience working as a professional engineers, which includes non-technical skills such as communication and working as a team.
 Work with engineering mentor to design and code features for our software pipeline.
 Perform testing and verify that code is correctly released into our production system.
Skills & Requirements
 Understanding Python stack, C# or Java
 Machine Learning and Modeling Interest
 Strong eye for design quality and intuitive user experience
 Data analytics & visualization a bonus

position: R&D Software Engineering Intern - Gap Year
description:
Are you aspiring to be a software or computer science engineer but want to defer your matriculation to college a year so you may gain a full year of experience first? We are currently looking for a student who wants to take a gap year and join our product development team in Indianapolis from July 2020 to August 2021. We design and manufacture robotic liquid handling systems and associated software for medical research and laboratory work. You will enjoy working on an active development project and will collaborate closely with talented and experienced engineers. Your work will contribute directly to our products, providing improvements to health and medicine around the globe.

Responsibilities:
• Work on a project under the direction of a mentor and in collaboration with other highly talented engineers from many disciplines.

• Document your findings and present your work to the team on a quarterly basis.

• Work both independently and on a team

Minimum Qualifications:
• Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field

• High School Diploma

• Analytical and problem-solving skills

• Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively

• Enthusiasm for learning new technologies and domains

• Desire to make software that delights users

• Strong documentation, communication, and interpersonal skills

• Understanding of the principles of object-oriented programming and functional programming

Preferred Qualifications:
• Interest or experience in the life sciences domain.

• Experience with modern revision control systems such as git.
